website_summaries.verdict: A traditional model that provides stability in a design that is also easy to transport and afford.
pros: This walker is easy to maneuver, as it is lightweight, sturdy, and simple to fold with the push of 2 buttons
Sides also remove easily for transporting and storage, and height is easy to adjust
cons: Doesn't come with wheels but separate ones are easily attached
Basic, but this isn't a deal-breaker for everyone

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for getting in and out of bathtub with no handles!
customer_reviews.text: We rent and have no bars in our bathroom - and are unable to install - but as we get older - I'm 68 - I've seen too many of my friends' lives change in an instant from a fall. So to keep my mind at ease, I felt this was the way to go - height ability, ease of folding, no wheels - I cannot tell you how much safer I feel when getting out of the tub now!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy walker
customer_reviews.text: I had a total knee replacement and needed a walker to assist me for about 3 weeks. I am a 59 year old male, 230lbs and not the most agile. This walker was easy to put together(match the letters to the letters). For 3 plus weeks, I leaned alot of my weight on this walker and there was never a problem. I felt very comfortable regarding the walker's ability to support me as I moved about. I did not use any wheels, however, I did use plastic sleds on the back legs which made it easier to slide across all surfaces. This walker did it's job wonderfully. Excellent quality and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Sugarbear21

customer_reviews.title: A good value compared to others !
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well built. It's a little harder to fold up then my old one was but it's not a deal breaker for the money. I took my wheels off my old one and put them on this one and it worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Willow

customer_reviews.title: ..peace of mind. .
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed for my husband's hip surgery coming up this year,thought they would be more costly, this is nice cause you don't have to use someone else's ,and just nice to have for what may come up,glad to have it..
customer_reviews.author: Patty k.

customer_reviews.title: Safety and reliability, did not feel secure with the unsteadiness of this walker.
customer_reviews.text: After using the walker for one week following hamstring surgery it was returned. Found this walker to be flimsy and unstable compared to our other walkers. I also ordered a tray to set on top to help with meals, turned out that it did not fit on the walker so this was also returned. Will continue to use our older walkers during the continuation of his rehab and physical therapy which is twelve weeks. Please note, he is 6 foot 210 #’s, the walker was set at the top notch
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase. Zero complaints.
customer_reviews.text: Everything can be improved upon, without improvement there’s no going up. I dunno maybe have an option to buy a basket or something. Hey there may have been...I didn’t notice. Anywho, my mom is in excellent shape for a woman with MS, a broken ankle and a almost gone case of shingles. This walker has been very good to us. My mom is 5’5 and like I dunno 150 maybe...I’d advise getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Provides improved mobility
customer_reviews.text: This was bought as a gift for a lady who lives in another country. The walker was easy to transport, it's very light weight. We didn't even have to repackage it. The recipient absolutely loves her new walker.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Wackie

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this walker for my father. Sturdy build. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this walker because it looked sturdier then others I looked at. It is reinforced with supporting rails on each side and across the front. You also have the option to purchase wheels for the front and back legs, which I did. All in all, this walker met every one of my expectations. It is sturdy, durable and the price was right. I highly recommend this walker for anyone that is looking to purchase one. It receives two thumbs up!!!!
customer_reviews.author: C. Boschert

customer_reviews.title: Loose screws danger!
customer_reviews.text: The screws keep coming out. Very bad quality. Nervous to use.
customer_reviews.author: william parrish

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed something for my mother after coming home from a long hospital stay and this was very easy to assemble and very sturdy and was easy for her to move around with --
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Has been an absolute necessity for my husband since his knee revision surgery
customer_reviews.text: As my husband is only allowed 50% weight bearing on his left knee after surgery, the walker has been essential. He used it without the wheels and slides prior to surgery but we added those since then. It is relatively easy to fold and very easy to unfold. Lightweight but sturdy enough for him at 270 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: GranB

customer_reviews.title: Not for bigger folks
customer_reviews.text: My dad is 6'4" and 300lbs....this was a bit to unstable for him.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Yasumura

customer_reviews.title: Great walker
customer_reviews.text: Great for my grandmother, she used to walk with a cane, but now is getting harder for her to stand up, this help her a lot.
customer_reviews.author: AbelMM

customer_reviews.title: Adjustability is key
customer_reviews.text: Loved this item. People must pay attention when buying this item as to whether or not it’s adjustable. If you are tall or short. You want to make sure you are not hunching over.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Hard to attach a hanging bag made for walkers because the front is not flat. Maybe a basket would fit?
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy to assemble and reassuringly sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Folds down to a very compact size to put in suitcase, very easy to assemble and reassuringly sturdy. Will use the walker after total hip replacement surgery, then will be able to disassemble to store for any future use.
customer_reviews.author: AndreaJL

customer_reviews.title: Height and weight
customer_reviews.text: My wife is having a knee replacement. The walker fits this need because it has no wheels which makes it sturdy, easy to fold, lightweight so it's easy to carry and to transport. Reasonably priced for the time it will be needed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I found the walker to be very sturdy & light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Kansas

customer_reviews.title: It sturdy and adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband. He only used it for a short time
customer_reviews.author: Lady L

customer_reviews.title: Arrived not bend. Easy to assemble. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. Arrived not bend. Easy to assemble. Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Steady
customer_reviews.text: Being used to help husband with small stroke, get up & down first step into pool
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be a good, basic, lightweight walker.
customer_reviews.text: I am using this walker while I recover from foot surgery. I can use it to get into places that are difficult to enter with a knee walker (which I am renting).
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: It is light weight and easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: My wife love's it and uses it around the house
customer_reviews.author: robert k morell

customer_reviews.title: Made well
customer_reviews.text: This was well made and I’m sorry I had to send it back but would not fix in or bathroom It was a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K. Umscheid

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper and easier to put into a car that are rollator.
customer_reviews.text: It's a replacement for my old Walker. Works just as good as the old one did. I am not a senior. I have secondary progressive MS which makes me walk like a senior.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and lightweight. Did exactly what I needed it to do.
customer_reviews.author: KHidalgo

customer_reviews.title: Nice little walker
customer_reviews.text: It's just the right size to fit through the narrow bathroom door, but it isn't very solid. It's light weight, which is nice and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Average, but good price.
customer_reviews.text: Walker at good price, but average. If you are a large person, you will not git within the handles for additional support.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: There were no instructions as to assembly. Just had to wing that.
customer_reviews.author: peggy gray

customer_reviews.title: works as described and was affordable
customer_reviews.text: like that the legs are adjustable to height and it is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: HAL

customer_reviews.title: What?
customer_reviews.text: I like having the tool, but not having to need it.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S. Ostro

customer_reviews.title: Product foldoing mechinism failed
customer_reviews.text: Product was terrible. Folding mechanism never worked correctly. Finally stopped working completely one after return window closed.
customer_reviews.author: BARRY FRIEDMAN

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it fits through the bathroom door. Easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like anything, but I will keep it instead of returning.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Easy to adjust height. Easy to fold. Light weight but seems sturdy. Good value
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble keeps you secure so you don’t loose your balance
customer_reviews.text: My wife was using it and she was very happy with
customer_reviews.author: Noor

customer_reviews.title: Mom's walker
customer_reviews.text: It works great. She only used it for a little while.
customer_reviews.author: Romanita Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy to handle
customer_reviews.text: It works for what my needs are. Very light weight so that I can get down the stairs to my car
customer_reviews.author: sevenofnineone

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: We got this for my friend she seems to really like it and will help in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This thing is junk! Only about 8 months old & already has cracks around the one fold button
customer_reviews.author: Steven T

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for the sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: I am 5 '1" And about 130# I am a pogo stick for 6 weeks while surgery heals. So I got this for the implied structural integrity. It is a decent and secure walker for me. I appreciate it has no wheels. I would need stitches probably if it had them. Since I bear all my body weight on my hands, I did Crutch-eze but that was for me. Not everyone will need those.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Mullarkey

customer_reviews.title: Need a taller version.
customer_reviews.text: Wish for a tall person there was a little more room in the legs to raise it and still have more length left for sturdiness. These should be sold by height of the client. I’m 5’7”. If I would have needed to raise it to the last hole, then it would be a little scary as it was for use in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this folding walker for my father! It's portable, light weight, foldable, sturdy and height adjustable! It's definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: It came on time, but had a connector cover missing on one of the legs. It is extremely wobbly and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Look elsewhere! I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Long

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my husband to use after a total knee replacement, his therapist couldn't believe the quality was this good for the price. I would definitely recommend this walker.
customer_reviews.author: liz w.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent basic folding walker
customer_reviews.text: Just what my wife wanted: a simple to use, lightweight walker that was stable but easy to fold to place it in the car or trunk. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my mother who is having trouble moving around. Very easy to assemble, and light weight. Very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: SANDRA SHAW

customer_reviews.title: This is great walker at great price
customer_reviews.text: My husband has one with wheels, but this one is better for our tile floors because it offers greater control
customer_reviews.author: Loubr

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 90 year old Mom
customer_reviews.text: This is a very stable walker, no wheels on it. Exactly what Mom needed. It is light, stable and quite sturdy. A no-nonsense, simple walker, as it should be.
customer_reviews.author: RobertoM

customer_reviews.title: Lighter walker
customer_reviews.text: A bit lighter & “looser” fitting than others. Otherwise a fine walker. Am using it for the shower after broken ankle.
customer_reviews.author: ms

customer_reviews.title: Walker
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I needed for post operative knee replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Book Luvr

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as pricier models.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it much. I use it alternately with a rollator walker in my apt. Works well. I have Parkinson’s. It certainly was a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Davis

customer_reviews.title: Width
customer_reviews.text: The best thing about this walker is that it easily moves through door ways.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin E. Higgens

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good enough for most people. Probably not a good idea to use if you are a heavyweight. 100 kilos plus.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron E Miller

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to fold and take with you. Sturdy and very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Wanderer

product_meta.title: CAREX Folding Walker for Seniors - Adult Walker - Portable Medical Walker with Adjustable Height, 30-37 Inches
product_meta.description: Size:1 Count (Pack of 1)The Carex Folding Standup Walker offers assistance while walking and standing. Height adjustable with marked peg holes from 30-37 inches. The narrow walker folds for easy transport and the sides are detachable for storing in tight spaces. A walker for the elderly that easily folds for transportation, perfect for walking and easily stored in the car for the Sunday drive or long trips. Walkers marked peg holes offer easy adjustment from 30-37 inches. The walker's sides detach for storing in tight spaces. A perfect walker for elderly, handicap, disable, or seniors.
feature_bullets: FOLDING WALKER. An adult walker that easily folds for transportation. Simply press on the two buttons and the walker folds up nicely. Walker is very sturdy, stable, and safe, made of 1 inch round aluminum construction. Supports a 300lb person.

HEIGHT ADJUSTABLE WALKER. A walker for seniors that is height adjustable. Marked peg holes allow the walker to be adjusted from 30-37 inches in height. Simply push the adjustment buttons in and slide the aluminum walker tubes up or down.
LIGHTWEIGHT WALKER. The mobility walker is very light and maneuverable and has sides that detach for storing in tight spaces. Walker only weighs 6 pounds.

ADD WHEELS and make this walker a rolling walker with wheels. Wheel attachment sold separately. Wheels are perfect for the elderly, seniors, or handicap with problems lifting the weight of the walker. Walker glides can also be added to the bottom of this walker.
TRUST CAREX, a leader in walkers for seniors and walkers for elderly. Carex Health Brands has been the branded leader in rollators, walkers, and adult mobility walkers for over 35 years.
